titles: An excellent ballad, entitul'd, The wandring Prince of Troy. To an excellent tune, call'd, Queen Dido, &c.
publisher: printed by and for W.O. and sold by J. Walker, at the Hand and Pen in High Holbourn,
notes: Verse - "When Troy town for ten years wars,".
First published [1660?] as: A proper new ballad, intituled, the wandring Prince of Troy. Cf. Wing P3668.
In four columns with the title and woodcut above the first two; the columns are not separated by rules.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
